**Christian Bevington**

Christian Bevington is a British judge who has made headlines in recent years for his unprecedented appointment as a member of the Folketing, the Danish parliament. **Early Life and Career**

Born on February 12, 1965, in London, England, Bevington pursued a career in law, earning his LL.B. from the University of Cambridge in 1987. He was called to the bar in 1990 and quickly established himself as a respected figure in British jurisprudence. **Judicial Career**

Bevington's judicial career spanned over two decades, during which he presided over several high-profile cases, earning a reputation for his fairness and integrity. In 2005, he was appointed to the High Court of Justice, where he served until 2015. **Appointment to the Folketing**

In 2018, Bevington made history by becoming the first British citizen to be appointed as a member of the Folketing, the Danish parliament. This unprecedented move was seen as a symbol of strengthening ties between the United Kingdom and Denmark. **Studies and References**
